thread.title: Chelsea news: John Terry steals Paul Scholes' nickname to describe Cesc Fabregas | Metro News
thread.title_full: Chelsea news: John Terry steals Paul Scholes' nickname to describe Cesc Fabregas | Metro News

author: Tom Olver For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Chelsea news: John Terry steals Paul Scholes' nickname to describe Cesc Fabregas | Metro News
text:
A post shared by Cesc Fàbregas (@cescf4bregas) on Feb 18, 2017 at 2:30pm PST 
Chelsea captain John Terry revealed an interesting nickname for Cesc Fabregas on Instagram… but Manchester United fans won’t be too happy about it. Theo Walcott left red-faced as Arsenal fans slam club for 'disrespectful' gesture 
Fabregas, who has struggled for game-time under Antonio Conte this term, made his 100th start for the Blues in their 2-0 victory over Wolves in the FA Cup and celebrated the feat after the game. 
‘100 starts for Chelsea,’ the Spanish midfielder wrote on Instagram, alongside a photograph of himself in action at Molineux. 
Fabregas was named man of the match for Chelsea after the fifth round clash and his skipper Terry was quick to praise the performance of the 29-year-old. 
Terry responded on Instragram: ‘#SatNav’ 
Once upon a time, Paul Scholes’ team-mates at Old Trafford also referred to him by the same nickname.
